instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
threads.message:
Arrived with fans spinning fast and SMC issue in Apple Diagnostic.

<CHIP>U4402</CHIP> was ripped off the board along with <CHIP>U5850</CHIP>. Fixed all the traces for <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> but <CHIP>U4402</CHIP> seems impossible. pads 6 and 7 are torn off with only the nittle nub remaining. These both only go under <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>

Is there any other way to try and fix besides soldering wire to little nub with <CHIP>U4402</CHIP> on top? Tried several times but fans continue to spin fast with SMC issue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
threads.message:
"SMC issue in Apple Diagnostic"
Is not SMC issue.
There should be an error code, to point what sensor is affected.
You can also run HWMonitor and look for strange temps reported.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
threads.message:
Rebuild all necessary traces and check for more knocked off components.
Check continuity between <CHIP>U5850</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5390</RESISTOR>/91 and be sure all surroubding resistors are good.

Did somneone change the battery?
Try known good trackpad flex/board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
threads.message: yes the battery was changed. When it first arrived it also had a  power management system error PPN001

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> smc issue
threads.message: Possibly damaged trackpad flex/board, when battery was removed.
